rules.title: Verify Patient Status
rules.condition: Patient initiates contact for an appointment or inquiry.
rules.action: Confirm if the patient is new or established in the system.
rules.example: Are you a new patient with us, or have you visited before?

rules.title: Acknowledge Patient Status
rules.example: Okay, thank you for confirming you're an established patient.

rules.title: Collect Identifying Information
rules.condition: After initial greeting and/or status acknowledgment.
rules.action: Request necessary personal details to find or create a patient record.
rules.example: To help me pull up your information, could I please get your full name and date of birth?

rules.title: Acknowledge Information Receipt
rules.condition: Patient provides identifying or other requested information.
rules.action: Confirm receipt of the information provided.

rules.title: Inform Chart Retrieval
rules.condition: After collecting identifying information and before proceeding.
rules.action: State that the chart is being retrieved and ask for a moment of patience.
rules.example: Please bear with me for just a moment while I pull up your chart.

rules.title: Determine Appointment Reason
rules.action: Inquire about the purpose of the call/appointment request and potentially details of the concern.
rules.example: What is the reason for your visit today? Or could you tell me a little more about what's bringing you in?

rules.title: Inquire About Insurance
rules.action: Ask for the patient's insurance carrier.
rules.example: Do you have insurance, and if so, what is your provider?

rules.title: Offer Specific Appointment Times
rules.condition: After determining the appointment reason and optionally insurance, and after the agent has checked for general appointment availability.
rules.action: Present specific available date and time options to the patient, or ask about their preferred specific dates and times.
rules.example: Okay, based on your reason for visit, we have specific openings on Tuesday, July 23rd at 10:00 AM or Thursday, July 25th at 2:00 PM. Do either of those work for you?
